title: [Large-scale] Video Segmentation-Based Multimedia Instructional Design Project for Assembly Task Education

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental Digital Tool Utilization Skills and Basic Understanding of Assembly Work
context.additional_context: Students form teams to analyze actual assembly work scenarios and produce systematic multimedia manuals using video splitting tools

learning_goals: Learners can design visual instruction steps segmented into three or more levels by recognizing naturally occurring event boundaries in assembly tasks.
Learners can accurately segment over 80% of task videos and generate step-by-step instructions using multimedia tools (IBES).
Learners validate the utility of their created manuals through peer assessment and achieve a usability score of 85% or higher.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
